ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.summary: Adds the ability to retry flaky tests in CI environments
Adds the ability to retry flaky tests in CI environments

name: pytest-retry
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pytest-retry" %}
{% set version = "1.7.0" %}
{% set python_min = "3.9" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/pytest_retry-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f8d52339f01e949df47c11ba9ee8d5b362f5824dff580d3870ec9ae0057df80f

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools >=61.0.0
    - wheel
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - pytest >=7.0.0

test:
  imports:
    - pytest_retry
  commands:
    - pip check
    # We need the pytest_retry source dir not to be on the import path,
    # because otherwise (if ChatGPT has it right) the pytest invocations in
    # the subprocesses created by the packages' pytester testdir.runpytest()
    # calls will pick up the package from the not-pytest-registered source tree,
    # instead of the fully-installed and pytest-plugin-registered package,
    # resulting in breakage of the test suite.
    #
    # We achieve this removal of the source dir from the import path via the
    # cd into `tests/`. pytest auto-locates the correct rootdir of `..`
    # (equal to `$SRC_DIR`) for us, and finds its config in pyproject.toml there.
    - cd tests
    # Some of the tests that assert against test run durations appear to be
    # flaky on Windows. So, we skip these in the recipe.
    - pytest -k "not test_duration_in_cumulative_timings_mode and not test_configuration_by_ini_file"
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - pytest >=7.0.0
  source_files:
    - tests/
    - pytest_retry/
    - pyproject.toml

about:
  home: https://github.com/str0zzapreti/pytest-retry
  summary: Adds the ability to retry flaky tests in CI environments
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  dev_url: https://github.com/str0zzapreti/pytest-retry

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bskinn
